intro: Eleocharis angolensis, commonly known as the Angola sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and swamps. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers. It is native to southern Africa, particularly Angola and Namibia. Eleocharis angolensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
